item.title: Banking command & wildy related - help
item.dc:creator: @gunztheduel gunztheduel
item.description:
@gunztheduel wrote:

[quote=“Newb 2341, post:6, topic:92985”]or maybe

else if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("bank")) { if (inwildy == false) openUpBank(); } else if (inwildy == true) { sendMessage("You can't bank in Wildy n33b!"); txt4 = "I am st00pid. I tried banking in the wildy. I am a dumbass."; } [/quote]

Nah, I tried doing that, I got error saying ‘else’ without ‘if’.
What does “txt 4 =” mean?

Read full topic

item.title: Banking command & wildy related - help
item.dc:creator: @Newb_2341 Newb 2341
item.description:
@Newb_2341 wrote:

Or, try

else if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("bank")) {
if (inwildy == false)
openUpBank();
}
} else {
{
sendMessage("You can't bank in Wildy n33b!");
}

or maybe

else if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("bank")) {
if (inwildy == false)
openUpBank();
}
else if (inwildy == true)
{
sendMessage("You can't bank in Wildy n33b!");
txt4 = "I am st00pid. I tried banking in the wildy. I am a dumbass.";
}

Read full topic

item.title: Banking command & wildy related - help
item.dc:creator: @Sick_of_Air Sick of Air
item.description:
@Sick_of_Air wrote:

Yeah, Newb is right. I just noticed that you did not have the else in there.

else if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("bank")) { if (inwildy == false) openUpBank(); } else { sendMessage("You can't bank in Wildy n33b!"); }

I believe that’s it.

Read full topic

item.title: Banking command & wildy related - help
item.dc:creator: @Newb_2341 Newb 2341
item.description:
@Newb_2341 wrote:

Yeah, gunz, you need the specific else or it won’t work.

Read full topic

item.title: Banking command & wildy related - help
item.dc:creator: @Sick_of_Air Sick of Air
item.description:
@Sick_of_Air wrote:

else if (command.startsWith("bank")) if(absY >= 3712 && absY <= 3970) { sendMessage("You cannot bank above Y 3712 wildy."); } else { openUpBank(); }

There’s mine, and I believe it works.

Read full topic

item.title: Banking command & wildy related - help
item.dc:creator: @gunztheduel gunztheduel
item.description:
@gunztheduel wrote:

I made my own command. It looks like this -
Can you guys tell me what’s wrong with it…

else if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("bank")) { if (inwildy == false) openUpBank(); } if (inwildy == true) { sendMessage("You can't bank in Wildy n33b!"); }

I compiled, no errors, and ran my server. I logged onto my server and I tried open the bank using ::bank in non wildy and it worked. Then I teleported to a wildy zone and tried it. It didn’t work and I got the sendMessage above ^. Then I went back to a non wild zone, and this time I couldn’t open the bank using ::bank. I got the sendMessage ^ aswell, W.T.F.?

Can anyone make me a command that when I bank in wildy I get that message, and when I bank in non wildy, I successfully bank? Sorry, I don’t know how to code.

Read full topic
